frames.input

Class Agent

  • java.lang.Object
    • frames.input.Agent
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Mouse

    public abstract class Agent
extends java.lang.Object
    Agents gather data from different sources --mostly from input devices such touch surfaces or simple mice-- and reduce them into a rather simple but quite 'useful' set of interface events (Event) for third party objects (Grabber objects) to consume them (handle(Event)). Agents thus effectively open up a channel between all kinds of input data sources and user-space objects. To add/removeGrabbers a grabber to/from the grabbers() collection issue addGrabber(Grabber) / removeGrabber(Grabber) calls. Derive from this agent and either call handle(Event) or override handleFeed() .

    The agent may send events to its inputGrabber() which may be regarded as the agent's grabber target. The inputGrabber() may be set by querying each grabber object in grabbers() to check if its Grabber.track(Event)) condition is met (see poll(Event), pollFeed()). The first grabber meeting the condition, namely the trackedGrabber()), will then be set as the inputGrabber(). When no grabber meets the condition, the trackedGrabber() is then set to null. In this case, a non-null inputGrabber() may still be set with setDefaultGrabber(Grabber) (see also defaultGrabber()).

      • inputGrabber

        public Grabber inputGrabber()
        If trackedGrabber() is non null, returns it. Otherwise returns the defaultGrabber().
        See Also:
        trackedGrabber()

      • isInputGrabber

        public boolean isInputGrabber(Grabber g)
        Returns true if g is the agent's inputGrabber() and false otherwise.

      • isTracking

        public boolean isTracking()
        Returns true if this agent is tracking its grabbers.

        You may need to enableTracking() first.

      • enableTracking

        public void enableTracking()
        Enables tracking so that the inputGrabber() may be updated when calling poll(Event).
        See Also:
        disableTracking()

      • disableTracking

        public void disableTracking()
        Disables tracking.
        See Also:
        enableTracking()

      • setTracking

        public void setTracking(boolean enable)
        Sets the isTracking() value.

      • trackedGrabber

        public Grabber trackedGrabber()
        Returns the grabber set after poll(Event) is called. It may be null.

      • defaultGrabber

        public Grabber defaultGrabber()
        Default inputGrabber() returned when trackedGrabber() is null and set with setDefaultGrabber(Grabber).
        See Also:
        inputGrabber(), trackedGrabber()

      • shiftDefaultGrabber

        public boolean shiftDefaultGrabber(Grabber g1,
                                   Grabber g2)
        Same as defaultGrabber() != g1 ? setDefaultGrabber(g1) ? true : setDefaultGrabber(g2) : setDefaultGrabber(g2) which is ubiquitous among the examples.
